# Improve accessibility of font colors (2025-11-14 04:55Z)

_**User (2025-11-14 01:51Z)**_

The light gray font across body font everywhere in this generation system, is unacceptable for accessibility reasons. Makes it difficult to read.

---

_**Agent (model composer-1, mode Agent)**_



---


Searching for font color definitions to replace light gray with a darker, accessible color.

---


Updating color definitions: `graytext` and `lighttext` are too light. Changing them to darker, accessible colors.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: /Volumes/EmmaSSD/Development/personal/about-me/src/awesome-cv.cls</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 2, lines removed: 2

```diff
@@ -137,6 +137,6 @@
  \definecolor{darktext}{HTML}{414141}
  \colorlet{text}{darkgray}
- \colorlet{graytext}{gray}
- \colorlet{lighttext}{lightgray}
+ \colorlet{graytext}{darkgray}
+ \colorlet{lighttext}{darkgray}
  \colorlet{sectiondivider}{gray}
  % Awesome colors
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---



---


Updated color definitions for accessibility:

- `graytext`: changed from `gray` (HTML 5D5D5D) to `darkgray` (HTML 333333)
- `lighttext`: changed from `lightgray` (HTML 999999) to `darkgray` (HTML 333333)

This affects:
- Cover letter body text (`lettertextstyle`)
- Header addresses
- Footer text
- Entry dates and positions
- Other elements using these colors

All text now uses `darkgray` (HTML 333333), which meets WCAG contrast requirements. Checking for linting issues:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="generic" data-tool-name="read_lints">
<details>
          <summary>Tool use: **read_lints** • Read lints for 1 file</summary>
      
Lint paths:

- `src/awesome-cv.cls`

Lint results


**No lint errors found**
</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Changes applied with no linting errors. All body text now uses `darkgray` (HTML 333333) instead of light gray, improving readability and meeting WCAG contrast requirements.

Regenerate your documents to see the updated text colors. The contrast ratio of dark gray on white is approximately 12.6:1, exceeding WCAG AAA standards.

---
